Pests and disease issues resulting from improper landscaping, maintenance, or lack of pest and disease management.
Soil erosion and poor drainage, leading to waterlogged soil, nutrient deficiencies, and root rot.
Inadequate sunlight exposure or the wrong type of soil composition, causing plants to struggle and fail to thrive.
Pest and weed infestation disrupting garden pests and affecting garden growth.
Watering system problems, such as leaks and inefficient watering, leading to overused water resources and increased maintenance costs.
